revised_title: Semidiurnal Tides of Frederiksdal in Greenland
tldr: This paper discusses the observations of semidiurnal tides in Frederiksdal, near Cape Farewell in Greenland. The observations were made by Missionary Asboe at the request of Admiral Irminger of the Royal Danish Navy. The results include the eccentricity of the lunar orbit, the mass of the Earth compared to the moon, and the depth of the Atlantic Ocean.
